title: Deep mediterranean quiche
summary: An Italian inspired quiche with sun dried tomatoes and courgette. A perfect light meal for a summer's day.
author: Umami
ingredients: For the pastry:,280g plain flour,140g butter,Cold water,For the filling:,1 onion (chopped),2 cloves of garlic (chopped),Half courgette (chopped),450ml soya milk,500g grated parmesan,2 eggs,200g sun dried tomatoes,100g feta
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 200C. Starting with the pastry; rub the flour and butter together in a bowl until crumbling like breadcrumbs. Add water, a little at a time, until it forms a dough.
  2. Roll out the pastry on a floured board and gently spread over your tin. Place in the fridge for 20 minutes before blind baking for a further 10.
  3. Whilst the pastry is cooling, gently cook the onions, garlic and courgette.
  4. In a large bowl, add the soya milk, half the parmesan, and the eggs. Gently mix.
  5. Once the pastry is cooked, spread the onions, garlic and sun dried tomatoes over the base and pour the eggs mix over. Sprinkle the remaining parmesan and careful lay the feta over the top. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Vegan chocolate brownies
author: Umami
ingredients: 170g self raising flour, 3 tablespoons of cocoa powder, 170g of caster sugar, 5 tablespoons of vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, pinch of salt, 230ml soy milk
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 180c and grease a 8 inch cake tin
  2. Sift the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl and add the sugar and salt.
  3. Add the oil, a little at time, mixing well to avoid lumps. Add the soy milk and vanilla extract and mix thoroughly.
  4. Gently pour into the cake tin and spread out until even. Bake for about 15 minutes and check with a knife (the knife should come out clean when inserted into the brownies 2cm from the edge).
  5. Allow to cool in the tin for a few minutes before cooling on a wire rack.

title: Veggie pasta bake
summary: A wholesome pasta bake is the ultimate comfort food. For any ferocious carnivore, bacon can be added with the onions and garlic for extra flavour.
author: Umami
ingredients: 500g pasta (penne or fusilli),1 spear of broccoli cut into bite size florets,1 onion (chopped),2 cloves of garlic (chopped),50g butter,50g plain flour,400ml milk,200g grated cheese,1 teaspoon of wholegrain mustard,Black pepper to taste
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 200C.
  2. Cook the pasta until it's starting to soften (al dente) and drop the broccoli into the boiling water for the last few minutes.
  3. Whilst the pasta is cooking, soften the onions and garlic in a little oil and add to the pasta and broccoli once it's drained.
  4. Now it’s time for the cheese sauce. Melt the butter over a medium heat, add the flour and make into a roux. Add the milk, a little at a time, stirring constantly to stop lumps forming. Add most of the cheese, mustard and season to taste with black pepper.
  5. Add the cheese sauce to the pan of pasta and broccoli, mix well, then transfer to an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and bake until golden brown.

title: Watercress soup
summary: A wonderfully simple and light soup, making the most of seasonal, local produce.
author: Umami
ingredients: 3 bunches of watercress,3 potatoes,3 onions,2 leeks,800ml stock,5 tablespoons of creme fraiche
recipe_instruction:
1. Prepare the vegetables by peeling and chopping the potatoes, finely chopping the onions, leeks and garlic.
  2. Heat a little oil in a pan and add the chopped veg, gently cooking them for about 5 minutes.
  3. Add the vegetable stock to the same pan and turn up the heat until simmering, adding the watercress after about 10 minutes. Cook until all the vegetables are soft and easily mashed.
  4. Liquidise the soup either with a hand blender or in a mixer, until smooth.
  5. If the soup has cooled too much whilst being liquidising, stir in the creme fraiche and reheat before serving (otherwise serve straight away). Season to taste.

title: Victoria sponge cake
summary: A traditional Victoria sponge cake, perfect for any afternoon with a cup of tea.
author: Umami
ingredients: 225g butter or margarine,225g caster sugar,225g self-raising flour,4 eggs,1 level teaspoon of baking powder,3 tablespoons of jam for the filling,Icing sugar to dust the top,Cream to serve
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 180C and grease two 8in cake tins.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the butter and sugar together, then add the eggs, flour and baking powder.
  3. Spread the mix evenly between the 2 cake tins.
  4. Place both tins in the middle of the preheated oven for 20 minutes, before checking with a knife. When the knife comes out clean, its ready!
  5. Allow to cool in the tins before moving them onto a cooling rack.
  6. Add the jam, stack, dust with icing sugar and serve with a big dollop of cream. And enjoy!

title: Gluten free pizza
summary: A gorgeous and simple gluten free pizza, with deliciously indulgent mozeralla and parma ham. Can easily be vegetarian by leaving out the ham.
author: Umami
ingredients: 400g gluten free flour, 125ml warm water, 125ml milk, one sachet of dried yeast, 2 teaspoons of sugar, 1 teaspoons of salt, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 4 tablespoons of tomato puree, 1 clove of garlic, Some fresh basil, 200g of mozzarella, 100g rocket, 5 slices of parma ham
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 220C. Mix the some of the milk and water in a jug, and add the yeast and sugar, then set aside.
  2. In a bowl, mix the flour, salt and oil. Slowly add the liquid from the jug and form into a dough.
  3. Break the dough in half and shape into two pizza bases. Set aside for about 15min, whilst making the topping.
  4. Spread the tomato puree over the pizza bases, chop the basil and rocket and sprinkle over the tomato. Lay the chopped parma ham on top and add thick slices of mozzarella across the pizza.
  5. Cook in the oven directly on the top shelf (with a tray underneath) for 10-12minutes until the mozzarella is bubbling. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Thai green curry
summary: A quick and easy version of the classic Thai green curry. Perfect for a mid week meal!
author: Umami
ingredients: 400g coconut milk, 400g chicken or tofu, 1 tablespoon of thai green curry paste, 1 clove of garlic, 2 teaspoons of fish sauce, 400g mushrooms, 200g green beans, Coriander, Jasmine rice
recipe_instruction:
1. In a large wok, brown the chicken until golden, then turn the heat down and gently cook the garlic. Add the chopped green beans and stir.
  2. Add the coconut milk, thai green curry paste and fish sauce. Mix well and slowly simmer.
  3. Add the chopped mushrooms and simmer until the chicken (or tofu) is cooked.
  4. Serve with jasmine rice and a sprinkle of coriander.
